programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. programme.desc: A couple stumble upon the body of an elderly man in the old hospital wing of an abandoned mental health facility, strapped to a gurney with electrodes connected to his temples.

programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

Pauline Quirke guest stars.

Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.desc: Robert tries to arrange a love-match between Eleanor and one of his old comrades-in-arms, but meets with a conspicuous lack of success. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.desc: Relishing the social prestige it confers, Hyacinth decides that she and husband Richard should have a weekend at a golfing hotel so that she can keep up with the Major and his wife. Roy Clarke's suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.desc: Hyacinth dreads the idea of attending Onslow's birthday celebrations. However, she changes her mind when she learns a limousine will be arriving to take her to the party. Starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

Harrow also learns that Fairley is a local hero for rescuing three children from a house fire in 1991, but still feels guilty about failing to rescue the fourth one. programme.desc: The team is drawn into the world of a strict religious sect when a father and son are murdered with copies of the Bible at their sides. Meanwhile, Reid investigates the disappearance of an old friend's daughter and uncovers a link to Burke's case. Detective drama, guest starring Sandy Morton, with Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart

Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Reece Dinsdale (Coronation Street) and Steve John Shepherd (Plus One), with Blythe Duff, John Michie and Alex Norton.

Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: The judge must decide the fate of a sick baby which has been refused further resuscitation by doctors. The infant's deeply religious parents disagree, and take the fight for their son's life to court. Meanwhile, a boy convicted of theft dies in custody - bringing Deed's own traumatic memories of childhood to the fore. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star.

programme.desc: Ellen Mallam is left to drown in an upturned car by its driver, but the young woman's connection to James Blackstone, an aristocratic family's heir apparent, impedes Gently and Bacchus's investigation. The chief inspector discovers that the son's future has been carefully mapped out since birth by his implacable mother Alethea, and she will not countenance any interference in her plans. However, an astonishing twist causes the detectives to reconsider the case in its entirety. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Geraldine Somerville, James Norton, Roger Lloyd Pack, Christopher Fairbank and Ebony Buckle.

programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness.

programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when barrister Luke Watchman dies of cyanide poisoning during his annual holiday at an inn. Crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide, Kevin McNally and William Simons.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

The case in question is the death of a jockey crushed by his mount during a race. The plot thickens when two of the horses' owners are killed in a helicopter crash and evidence emerges that both the horse and the pilot were drugged. James Wilby and Sylvestra Le Touzel guest star.

Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The television presenter and comedian takes on an epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter, a spectacular but deadly time of year to see the unforgiving, ice-bound region. His odyssey is full of surprises as he witnesses natural wonders and discovers the magnetic lure of the far north. The first edition sees Alexander begin in Scandinavia and head toward Iceland, as he swims with locals in the ocean, faces the worst storm in 25 years, and goes down the world's first major tunnel to be built into the heart of a glacier.

Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: In a reality TV special, former Gogglebox star and 2016 Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt takes on 2019 Love Island contestant Curtis Pritchard. The pair - along with their families - go head to head in the knockout tournament, hoping to advance to the next round. Presented by Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: As life in lockdown continues, Martin Lewis has up-to-the-minute advice for these financially uncertain times. He'll be taking viewers' questions on how the ongoing crisis affects family finances, jobs and consumer rights, and offers money-saving tips and tricks.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the dramatic story of an amateur pilot who built his own plane, but then lost his propeller mid-flight and had to try to land it without any power. A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: Euro 96 England v Netherlands - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the memorable Group A match, which came from Wembley Stadium. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from John Barnes and Jack Charlton, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five neighbours from Lancashire answer questions on subjects that include Jane Austen, food and drink and film, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of London gym trainers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Jason, Christine, Karen and Mark work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker visits the Isle of Man, where her favourite island walk has it all - an ancient Manx river glen, the world's biggest mining waterwheel and a climb that culminates with spectacular views of England, Scotland and Ireland. With steam trains and electric trams on the TT island famous for Thomas the Tank Engine, her latest trek promises to be action-packed.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla is cornered by a mystery girl in the Rovers and Tim starts to wonder about Geoff's protestations of innocence after Sally tells him she wants Geoff out of the house. Ken fears that Daniel is neglecting himself and Toyah worries about Leanne after she tells her that Oliver has regressed.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey is very welcoming when a surprise visitor turns up in the form of the attractive Emma, although Sharon is suspicious of the newcomer and Dorien is shocked to the core. Travis, on the other hand, is over the moon. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Charlie Quirke.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.sub-title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories: Martin Kemp
programme.desc: The actor and musician joins the host to look back over his life and career. Martin, who found fame as the bassist in Spandau Ballet, before going on to star in EastEnders and The Krays, tells of the brain tumours that nearly killed him and reveals that George Michael helped him find a wife, as well as land his TV soap role. He also opens up about the deaths of his parents within days of each other, and how this prompted his band to get back together.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win Â£25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.
